isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOOR WINDOW SLIDE BLOCK

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Window Slide Block for Cab Door with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

note.para: It is not necessary to remove the cab door glass to remove the cab door window slide block.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 39
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: For vehicle equipped with electric door window, lower cab door glass (Item 1) to the bottom of cab door (Item 2) before disconnecting electric window switch panel (Item 3) during cab door trim panel (Item 4) removal.

Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For removing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Working through cab door access opening (Item 5), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 6), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 7) and pivot ball (Item 8) from cab door window slide block (Item 9) in cab door window slide rail (Item 10), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 39. Cab Door Window Slide Block on Cab Door with Electric Door Window and Locks

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para:
Working through the cab door access opening (Item 5, Figure 39)
, using a small flat blade screw driver (Item 1), carefully brake off the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) used to keep the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from sliding off the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.
Once the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) is removed , slide the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 40. Cab Door Window Slide Block

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door window slide block.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Window Slide Block for Cab Door with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

note.para: It is not necessary to remove the cab door glass to remove the cab door window slide block.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 41
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: For vehicle equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 1) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 2) and lower cab door glass (Item 3) to the bottom of cab door (Item 4), driver side shown.

Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For removing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Working through cab door access opening (Item 5), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 6), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 7) and pivot ball (Item 8) from cab door window slide block (Item 9) in cab door window slide rail (Item 10), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Cab Door Window Slide Block on Cab Door with Manual Door Window and Locks

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 40
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Working through the cab door access opening (Item 5, Figure 39) , using a small flat blade screw driver (Item 1), carefully brake off the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) used to keep the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from sliding off the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.
Once the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) is removed , slide the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door window slide block.
